item.title: 梅洛尼表示，Mediobanca 的收购反映了 Monte Paschi 的实力
item.description: 意大利总理乔治亚-梅洛尼（Giorgia Meloni）表示，Banca Monte dei Paschi di Siena SpA 对竞争对手 Mediobanca SpA 的收购要约是一次 "市场运作"，反映了这家重振旗鼓的银行的实力。【原文：Banca Monte dei Paschi di Siena SpA’s takeover bid for rival Mediobanca SpA is a “market operation” reflecting the revived lender’s strength, Italian Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni said.】

item.title: 加纳贸易顺差首次达到 50 亿美元，原因是黄金价格暴涨
item.description: 随着加纳黄金出口额的飙升，加纳的年度贸易顺差在 2024 年首次达到 50 亿美元。【原文：Ghana’s annual trade surplus reached $5 billion in 2024 for the first time ever as the value of the country’s gold exports soared.】

item.title: 前银行家温习法语，特鲁多内阁为卡尼排兵布阵
item.description: 贾斯汀-特鲁多（Justin Trudeau）总理的内阁高层已经就接替他担任加拿大总理的人选做出了决定，他们支持马克-卡尼（Mark Carney）。【原文：The senior ranks of Prime Minister Justin Trudeau’s cabinet have made their choice on who they believe should replace him as Canada’s prime minister — and they’re throwing their weight behind Mark Carney.】

item.title: 马斯克探索区块链在美国政府提高效率工作中的应用
item.description: 据知情人士透露，埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）已经开始就在新成立的政府效率部（Department of Government Efficiency）中使用区块链技术展开对话。这是特朗普政府努力支持数字资产行业的最新迹象。【原文：Elon Musk has initiated conversations about using blockchain technology at the new Department of Government Efficiency, according to people with knowledge of the discussions. It’s the latest sign of the Trump administration’s efforts to bolster the digital asset industry.】

item.title: 泽连斯基称乌克兰已准备好从阿塞拜疆转运天然气
item.description: 乌克兰总统沃洛德梅尔-泽连斯基（Volodymyr Zelenskiy）表示，乌克兰随时准备从阿塞拜疆向欧洲转运天然气，如果能达成协议，很快就能签署合同。【原文：Ukraine stands ready to transit natural gas from Azerbaijan to Europe and a contract could be inked quickly if an agreement can be reached, according to Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy.】

item.title: 华尔街周齐心协力应对风险
item.description:
洛杉矶野火凸显了为灾难做好准备的必要性

【原文：

The Los Angeles wildfires highlight the need to prepare for catastrophes

】

item.title: 股市因盈利大获全胜而跳涨，涨幅创2018年以来之最
item.description: 在通胀和利率前景充满不确定性的情况下，有一种可靠的催化剂让华尔街精神为之一振：美国公司的底线。【原文：With uncertainty swirling around the outlook for inflation and interest rates, there’s been one dependable catalyst keeping Wall Street’s spirits lifted: Corporate America’s bottom line.】

item.title: 欧洲国防建设提供经济缓冲
item.description: 冷战的结束带来了无数好处。但对于迄今为止美国经济总量最大的州--加利福尼亚州来说，冷战的结束却是一场灾难。随着国防开支的下滑，金州失去了数十万个中产阶级的工作岗位，造成了自 20 世纪 30 年代以来最严重的经济衰退。【原文：The end of the Cold War had countless benefits. But for California, by far the largest US state by economic output, it was a crippling event. As defense spending slumped, the Golden State lost hundreds of thousands of middle-class jobs, contributing to its worst slump since the 1930s.】

item.title: 全球经济图表：日本央行提高利率
item.description: 日本央行将其关键政策利率上调至 2008 年以来的最高水平，并对通胀力度持更加乐观的看法。【原文：The Bank of Japan raised its key policy rate to the highest level since 2008 and took a more bullish view on the strength of inflation.】

item.title: 意大利称 Paschi 竞购 Mediobanca 符合国家利益
item.description: 意大利将支持贷款机构 Banca Monte dei Paschi Siena SpA 竞购规模更大的竞争对手 Mediobanca SpA，称竞购成功将有利于该国经济。【原文：Italy will support lender Banca Monte dei Paschi Siena SpA’s bid to take over larger rival Mediobanca SpA, saying a successful move would benefit the country’s economy.】

item.title: 蕾切尔-里夫斯如何决定英国需要为经济增长下大注
item.description: 在 10 月 30 日英国预算案公布后不久，经济情绪急剧下降，企业抗议提高税收，压力重重的雷切尔-里夫斯向财政部官员传达了一个关键信息："我们需要在增长方面走得更远更快"【原文：Soon after her UK budget on Oct. 30, as economic sentiment plummeted and businesses protested higher taxes, an under-pressure Rachel Reeves had one key message for Treasury officials: “We need to go further and faster on growth.”】

item.title: 旧办公楼空置，法兰克福天际线变暗
item.description: 在法兰克福最中心的街区之一，距离法兰克福火车总站仅咫尺之遥，一栋 19 层的高层建筑曾被 DZ 银行的联合投资部门占用，现已空置四年多。【原文：In one of Frankfurt’s most central neighborhoods, a stone’s throw from the city’s main train station, a 19-story highrise once occupied by DZ Bank’s Union Investment unit has been vacant for more than four years.】

item.title: 受房地产市场低迷影响，中国未能实现财政支出目标
item.description: 由于房地产市场不景气，地方政府资金紧张，无法兑现资金承诺，中国政府未能实现去年的支出目标。【原文：China’s government failed to meet its spending target for last year, as the housing market slump left local governments strapped for cash and unable to meet funding commitments.】

item.title: 墨西哥央行将考虑在 2025 年初加大降息力度
item.description: 墨西哥中央银行在一份报告中称，由于通胀放缓，该行可能在今年的首次货币政策会议上更大幅度地下调基准利率。【原文：Mexico’s central bank could make larger cuts to the benchmark interest rate at the year’s first monetary policy meetings due to slowing inflation, the board said in a report.】

item.title: Japfa 家族提议将新加坡家禽公司私有化
item.description: Japfa 有限公司已故创始人的家族成员提出将这家新加坡肉类生产商私有化，公司估值为 11.8 亿新元（8.77 亿美元）。【原文：The family members of Japfa Ltd.’s late founder have offered to take the Singapore meat producer private, valuing the company at S$1.18 billion ($877 million).】

item.title: 卢比奥鼓励越南解决与美国的贸易失衡问题
item.description: 国务卿马可-卢比奥在与越南外长裴青善的通话中鼓励越南解决与美国的贸易不平衡问题。【原文：Secretary of State Marco Rubio encouraged Vietnam to address its trade imbalances with the US in a call with Foreign Minister Bui Thanh Son.】

item.title: 英国游客暑期出游受通胀上调影响
item.description: 最新分析显示，与 2024 年相比，今年欧洲套餐假期的价格最高上涨了 11.5%。【原文：European package holidays are up to 11.5% more expensive this year compared with 2024, according to new analysis.】

item.title: 人工智能驱动的电力繁荣将使美国顶级电网的需求增加 38
item.description: 由于人工智能的蓬勃发展，美国最大电网的电力需求将快速增长，这相当于在未来十年内安装两个新英格兰电网。【原文：Electricity demand on the largest US grid is poised to rise so fast thanks to the AI boom that it’ll be the equivalent of installing two New England networks in the coming decade.】

item.title: 日产汽车寻求为特朗普的北美生产计划保驾护航
item.description: 日产汽车公司（Nissan Motor Co.）在墨西哥的一家合资企业停止生产后，可能会放缓在美国生产电动汽车的计划，这表明美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）的第二届政府对能源和贸易政策感到不安。【原文：Nissan Motor Co. may slow a planned ramp-up of electric vehicles made in the US after halting output at a joint venture in Mexico, signaling unease about energy and trade policy under President Donald Trump’s second administration.】

item.title: 这家香港报纸销售商正在为人民币崩溃做准备
item.description: 货币交易商若想寻找下一个好点子，最好去找在香港中环经营报摊的黄先生谈谈。【原文：Currency traders looking for their next big idea could do worse than talk to Wong, who runs a news stand in Hong Kong’s Central District.】

item.title: 星巴克首席执行官上任四个月赚了 9600 万美元
item.description: 星巴克公司（Starbucks Corp. ）新任首席执行官布莱恩-尼科尔（Brian Niccol）去年工作四个月就获得了约 9600 万美元的报酬，这是美国企业中最大的薪酬之一。【原文：Starbucks Corp. paid new Chief Executive Officer Brian Niccol about $96 million for four months of work last year, one of the biggest compensation packages in corporate America.】

item.title: 摩托车制造商 KTM 的贷款人以新计划抵制债务提议
item.description: 现已破产的奥地利摩托车制造商 KTM AG 的一组贷款人正在反击该公司计划进行的重组，并提出了他们自己的计划，以改善债权人的前景。【原文：A group of lenders to the now-insolvent Austrian motorcycle manufacturer KTM AG are pushing back against a restructuring planned by the company and proposing their own plan to improve creditors’ prospects.】

item.title: 中国消费者最终会开始消费吗？
item.description:
中国政府正在向全国人民求助，以帮助这个世界第二大经济体走出困境。要是这么简单就好了。【原文：

China’s government is turning to the country’s citizens to help pull the world’s second-biggest economy out of a rut. If only it were so simple.

】

item.title: 阿根廷获得穆迪评级上调，促进米莱发展
item.description: 穆迪评级公司（Moody's Ratings）上调了阿根廷的信用评级，称阿根廷政府为稳定财政所做的努力降低了其赖账的可能性。【原文：Argentina’s credit rating was raised by Moody’s Ratings, which said the government’s efforts to stabilize its finances has decreased the likelihood it will renege on debt obligations.】

item.title: 对冲基金 Polar Asset 聘请道明证券的 Cope 领导固定收益业务
item.description: 加拿大最大的对冲基金之一 Polar Asset Management Partners 正在聘请多伦多道明银行全球固定收益主管 Jason Cope，以推进其扩张计划。【原文：Polar Asset Management Partners, one of Canada’s largest hedge funds, is hiring Toronto-Dominion Bank’s head of global fixed income, Jason Cope, as it pushes ahead with a planned expansion.】

item.title: 特朗普因贸易缓和引发全球首周意外反弹
item.description: 特朗普执政的第一周，正如宣传的那样，金融市场充满了激动人心的气氛，但却不是大多数投资者所期待的那种。【原文：Week one of the Trump administration was, as advertised, full of excitement in financial markets — just not the kind of excitement most investors had anticipated.】

item.title: 因预算赤字膨胀，S&P 下调罗马尼亚债务展望
item.description: S&P全球评级公司（S&P Global Ratings）表示，可能会将罗马尼亚的信用评级下调至垃圾级，因为罗马尼亚政府将在重新举行总统选举前努力应对欧盟最大规模的预算赤字。【原文：S&P Global Ratings signaled it may cut Romania’s credit score to junk as the government grapples with the European Union’s widest budget deficit ahead of a presidential election re-run.】

item.title: 银行准备出售多达 30 亿美元的 X 收购债务
item.description: 据一位知情人士透露，以摩根士丹利为首的银行集团正准备出售多达 30 亿美元的债务，这些债务曾为埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）收购社交媒体平台 X（前身为 Twitter）提供资金。【原文：A group of banks led by Morgan Stanley is preparing to offload as much as $3 billion of debt that helped finance Elon Musk’s buyout of X, the social-media platform formerly known as Twitter, according to a person with knowledge of the matter.】

item.title: 光速 20 亿美元的人类学巨额投资巩固了风险投资公司的人工智能雄心
item.description:
这家拥有 25 年历史的风险投资公司正在迎接科技新时代的巨额人工智能交易

。【原文：

The 25-year-old venture capital firm is embracing tech’s new era of enormous artificial intelligence deals

】

item.title: 调查发现，近一半的 MBS 投资者预计房利美和房地美将于 2028 年私有化
item.description: 摩根大通银行（JPMorgan Chase & Co.）周五发布的一份报告显示，几乎半数购买机构抵押贷款支持证券的投资者在调查中表示，他们预计房利美（Fannie Mae）和房地美（Freddie Mac）将在未来四年的某个时候私有化。【原文：Almost half of investors who buy agency mortgage-backed securities said in a survey by JPMorgan Chase & Co. they expect Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac will be privatized sometime in the next four years, according to a note released Friday.】
